#Text=Niterói
#Text=Niterói
#Text=( 476,000 inhabitants ) is a city in the state of Rio de Janeiro , Brazil .
#Text=Nicknamed " The Smile City " ( Cidade Sorriso ) , it is just a short ferry ride from downtown Rio across Guanabara Bay .
#Text=In fact you may encounter plenty of reasons to smile about : many beautiful beaches ( within the bay or facing the open ocean ) , historic forts and a world-class museum .

#Text=Besides , Niteroi is scheduled to become in a near future the place with the largest number of works from renowned architect Oscar Niemeyer - second only to the entire Brazilian capital , Brasilia .
#Text=By boat
#Text=The ferry between Rio and Niteroi is a pleasant and affordable trip .
#Text=It takes between 10 and 20 minutes to cross the bay , depending on the fare for a slow or fast boat from adjoining terminals at Praça XV .
#Text=By car or bus
#Text=From Rio you just drive through the longest bridge in Brazil , the Ponte Rio-Niterói ; just like the name says it connects both cities .
#Text=It´s 13 km ( 8 mi ) in length and there is a toll of R$ 3,20 ( you pay 1 way only , coming from Rio ) .
#Text=If you are coming from Búzios or Cabo Frio you take the highway called " Via-lagos " .
#Text=Get around

#Text=On Saturdays and Sundays the " Linha Turismo " ( Tourism Line ) operates on schedule leaving the Arariboia Square ( @ the Fery Station ) at 10AM , 12:30PM and 2:30PM and making 7 different stops along Niteroi 's main attractions from downtown to the Fortress ( R$ 10 for a round-trip all day hop in and out ticket ) .
#Text=To get to the Oceanic Area you 'd better have a car , otherwise take a municipal bus at the Bus Terminal next to the Ferry Station .
#Text=Look for the specific Beach name sign on the bus(30~40~50 minutes ride from downtown to Piratininga/Camboinhas ~ Itacoatiara ~ Itaipu respectively ) .
#Text=See
#Text=Niterói Contemporary Art Museum
#Text=( Museu de Arte Contemporânea de Niterói — MAC ) , Mirante da Boa Viagem ( Get bus 47B from the bus terminal on your left when you exit the ferry station ) , ☏ +5521 2620-2400 .
#Text=Tu - Su 10AM-6PM , or 7PM during daylight savings time .
#Text=Built in 1996 , this intriguing contemporary art museum looks like a flying saucer jutting out over the sea and is worth the visit to Niteroi alone .
#Text=R$ 4 .
#Text=People 's Theater
#Text=( Teatro Popular Oscar Niemeyer ) ( beyond the Bus Terminal to your left as you exit the Ferry Station ) , ☏ +5521 8449-7393 .
#Text=Opened in 2007 this is the new addition to the Caminho Niemyer ( Niemeyer Way ) , a series of Architectural buildings along Niteroi 's Bayside .
#Text=Parque da Cidade
#Text=.
#Text=An amazing view of Rio de Janeiro ( city ) .
#Text=Watching the sunset from there is a ' must do ' if you are in Rio .
#Text=It is on the top of a mountain in the ' Charitas ' neighborhood .
#Text=You can go there by car / taxi .
#Text=Fortaleza de Santa Cruz

#Text=( 1555)- located at the Guanabara Bay entrance , this is a big fortress with a close-up view of the Sugar Loaf Mountain from an entirely different angle . ( R$ 4 guided tours ) Thu~Sun 10AM-5PM -> To get here on the weekdays you will need a car/taxi , but on Sat and Sun you can take a tourist open bus ( called Jardineira)in downtown Niteroi at the Ferry Station .
#Text=It runs all the way along the bayshore and stops at the town 's main attractions and neighborhoods .
#Text=Barao do Rio Branco(1555 ) , Imbui(1863/1901 ) and São Luis(1715/1775 ) Forts

#Text=- enter at Rio Branco Fort in Jurujuba for a guided tours of this and the other 2 forts and ruins overlooking the bay with a splendid view of the surrounding mountains of Niteroi and Rio . ( R$ 6 each Fort ) Al .
#Text=Mal .
#Text=Pessoa Leal , 265 - Sat .
#Text=& Sun 9:30AM-4PM
#Text=Beaches
#Text=Niterói has a wonderful unique view of Rio and one of the state 's most beautiful beaches , Itacoatiara , which can be reached by bus number 38 .
#Text=It is considered a surfer 's paradise ( actually it takes part of a world circuit of Surfer 's Competition ) .

#Text=Expect a young and beautiful crowd , have a snack at one of the healthy cabana-bars along the shore or yet , take trails to climb the mountains and watch a uniquely crazy sport : " Rock Surfing " .

#Text=Not further from here you can find the " lost in time " Itaipu Beach , a fishermen 's colony surrounded by sand dunes , a lagoon , a canal , a white church on a hill and some colonial era ruins .
#Text=It is probably one of the best sunsets you can see over Rio 's shoreline ( Copacabana , Ipanema & Barra on the horizon ) .
#Text=Also worthwhile is a visit to next door Camboinhas Beach ( it 's easier and faster to hire a fisherman 's boat to cross the canal than driving around the lagoon to get there ) .
#Text=Other beaches include : Piratininga , Prainha ( cliff diving from the Whale Rock ) and Sossego , all on the Atlantic side .

#Text=Boa Viagem , Inga , Icarai , São Francisco , Charitas , Jurujuba ( fishermen village , not proper for bathing)and Adao & Eva , all along the Bay starting at downtown and ending at the Fortress .
#Text=Do
#Text=Shopping
#Text=-
#Text=Icaraí is where the upper middle class lives .
#Text=So there are plenty of nice shops for all tastes .
#Text=" Moreira Cesar " ( 1st street parallel to the beach)is the most popular shopping street in town .
#Text=Here you will find exclusive and expensive boutiques such as Animale , Agilita , H. Stern , Salinas ( beachware ) all the way down to little t-shirt shops .
#Text=There are plenty of exotic juice bars and little restaurantes here as well .
#Text=Do n't leave town without tasting Acai , a Brazilian fruit from the Amazonas which is served very cold and has a very special flavor . .
#Text=Meanwhile in Downtown ( Centro ) , the Plaza Shopping is the largest shopping mall in town and is conveniently located across from the ferry Station ( Estacao das barcas ) .
#Text=Here you will find basically all the stores that you would find in any mall in nearby Rio de Janeiro .
#Text=Icaraí
#Text=is to Niteroi what Copacabana is to Rio 's residents : the most traditional neighborhood with excellent shopping opportunities and great restaurants .
#Text=Great for jogging and biking with a view of Rio 's main landmarks across the Guanabara Bay ( one of the 7 natural wonders of the world ) : the Sugar Loaf and the Corcovado .
#Text=How can you ask for more ?
#Text=Nightlife
#Text=- " São Francisco " the adjacent neighborhood is filled with lively bars , pubs and restaurants especially on the ocean front .
#Text=There are not many discos in Niterói as people prefer to go to Rio to dance .
#Text=Hang-glide
#Text=from Parque da Cidade ( see above )
#Text=Windsurf
#Text=in Charitas and São Francisco
#Text=Cliff Diving
#Text=in Prainha dew Piratininga
#Text=Guanabara Bay Tour
#Text=- 2 hour
#Text=Bay cruise on a ferry where a camera is a must .
#Text=Showcases Rio and Niteroi 's postcards ( narration is in Portuguese only , but the view is worth a thousand words ) .
#Text=Sundays only , departs @ 9:30AM from the Main Ferry Station in downtown .
#Text=R$ 12
